intro: Kibara obtusa, commonly known as the broad-leaf kibara, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves that are often hairy on the underside. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Kibara obtusa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
